meanings.definition: The study of plant communities and their relationships with each other and their environment.
meanings.sent1: In phytosociology, scientists observe how different plants interact in nature.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use phytosociology to understand how plants depend on each other in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The phytosociology class had a field trip to see how plants gossip with each other.
meanings.sent4: The forest can be seen as a phytosociology of interconnected green neighborhoods.
meanings.sent5: Through phytosociology, we can visualize the intricate web of plant relationships.

meanings.definition: The branch of ecology that focuses on the classification and analysis of plant communities.
meanings.sent1: Phytosociology helps scientists organize and study different plant groups.
meanings.sent2: Ecologists rely on phytosociology to categorize plant communities for research.
meanings.sent3: The phytosociology conference featured a debate on the best way to sort plant gangs.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, each flower bed represents a unique phytosociology waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on phytosociology provides a roadmap to understanding plant group dynamics.
